comments.body:
I think the failure is caused by the value that the property gets reset to. The default/reset value is an empty string and it does not pass the checks for path correctness. Hence the failure to reset the property. In general, most use cases with a SAN backend specify the ncpath and or scpath since the data plane is usually different than the control plane represented by sanhost property. If the scpaths/ncpaths are not configured, the code falls back to sanhost. 

I dont think its a critical issue to not be able to reset these properties. Its more of a usability and inconsistency with semantics issue The fix should be very straightforward and small.
Reducing the priority of the issue for the above stated reason
[~tjcramer], yep, I should be able to get this in for 4.1.1

Default values for ncpaths and scpaths is "nopath". Storage Controller recognizes this default and switches to using value of sanhost property if either of these properties is configured to "nopath". euca-modify-property -r <property-name> will now reset these properties to "nopath" without throwing an errors. 

{noformat}
# euca-modify-property -r one.storage.ncpaths
PROPERTY        one.storage.ncpaths     nopath was 10.107.1.1
# euca-modify-property -r one.storage.scpaths
PROPERTY        one.storage.scpaths     nopath was 10.107.1.1
{noformat}

[~swathi], looks like the commit went into {{master}} branch only. Should we change the fixVersion or this was meant to be in 4.1.2 as well?

commit: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/011631416f75ae530c3c9da884610761d8908f94

[~shaon] - I just checked the commit you referred and its in maint-4.1 branch. Here is a list of commits to maint-4.1 so far - https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commits/maint-4.1, my commit is in the list. 

Is there any particular reason you think that the commit may not have been included? Have you tried testing the fix with the latest build from maint-4.1 branch?
